pageContext.claim: “His brother, who didn't have experience became a big builder in Iraq, without experience.”
pageContext.analysis: James Biden, brother of Joe Biden, worked at HillStone International, a construction management firm. David Richter, a Republican congressional candidate and former CEO of HillStone International’s parent company, told the New Jersey Globe that the company only received a single government contract: a project with a South Korean real estate developer to build houses in Iraq. The contract was awarded by the Iraqi government, not the U.S. government. And in 2014, the HillStone Iraq deal fell through because of a lack of financing.
